kickstart.post:
mkdir /var/log/rocks /sbin/chkconfig img-storage-vm on
#!/bin/bash # # while for the config file to be ready
while [ ! -f /opt/rocks/etc/rabbitmq.conf ] ; do sleep 1; done
/sbin/service img-storage-vm start
# we need this only the first boot after the installation # after that the file will be there rm /etc/rc.d/rocksconfig.d/post-99-restart-img-storage

post.file:
#!/bin/bash # # while for the zfs user to appear
while [ ! `id -u zfs` ];do sleep 5 done
# so udevd sees that there is not zfs group at boot time # then it caches that value for the 91-zfs-permissions.rules # # to stop this behaviour we need to touch the file # so udev will reparse the rules and properly load the group # # 1 day of debugging to figure this out! touch /etc/udev/rules.d/91-zfs-permissions.rules /sbin/udevadm trigger
# we need this only the first boot after the installation # after that the file will be there rm /etc/rc.d/rocksconfig.d/post-98-restart-udev-zfs-perm
